subNodes.conversationText: Whatever magic animated the stone demons began to dissipate. Enough remained to send them back to their posts in the four corners of the tomb. There they would continue their vigil as ordinary statues for many years to come.

The hollow voice spoke from the coffin again. "Find my siblings, the other ronin. They, too, will offer you their swords, and if you take them properly, in the way doing most honor to our lord, a greater boon."
The battle was over. As before, the stone demons returned to their places.
Four phantoms appeared before the young witch.
"Your work honors our lord. Go now. Armed with the four swords, meet the beast that confounded us."

The phantoms faded from the witch's view. The tomb and everything in it did too, until only the silk drape on the casket was visible. The red swam and twisted against the backdrop of the fading scene.
<FirstName> blinked. <He/She> was standing at a crossroads. In the middle, a colorful dragon perched on a boulder, its long body draped over it like a ribbon. It beckoned <him/her> onward.
"Beast? I thought I was getting a boon!"

The phantoms faded from the witch's view. The tomb and everything in it did too, until only the silk drape on the casket was visible. The red swam and twisted against the backdrop of the fading scene.
The young witch said nothing. What new trial was this?

The phantoms faded from the witch's view. The tomb and everything in it did too, until only the silk drape on the casket was visible. The red swam and twisted against the backdrop of the fading scene.
Four phantoms appeared before the young witch.
"The bamboo breaks, the chrysanthemums open. Seek out the other ronin, always doing honor to our lord."
"The bamboo breaks, the chrysanthemums open. Seek out the other ronin, always doing honor to our lord."
"The bamboo breaks, the chrysanthemums open. Seek out the other ronin, always doing honor to our lord."
"The bamboo breaks, the chrysanthemums open. Seek out the other ronin, always doing honor to our lord."
The battle was over. As before, the stone demons returned to their places.

There was a silence. Then the young witch heard the disembodied intonation again, but this time as a chorus of four voices: "Malicious or ignorant, you've trespassed against our lord. Poach at leisure, while leisure you have... But you'll have no boon."
The battle was over. As before, the stone demons returned to their places.
No hollow voice came from the casket.
